p: Both isomers of β-ocimene, together with linalool, are frequently found in species pollinated by butterflies, bees, and moths (Andersson, 2003; Dötterl and Schäffler, 2007; Gong et al., 2014). TanM population emitted the highest quantity of both isomers [(Z)-β-ocimene, 6.4% and (E)-β-ocimene, 7.5%] and could have therefore differentiated its VOC emission to attract its peculiar type of pollinators (Dudareva et al., 2013).
